intro: Seseli roylei, commonly known as the Kashmir seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Seseli roylei is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in its native range.
